item.title: Cost-cutting pays off at Home Depot
item.description: The world’s largest home improvement retailer reported better-than-expected results for the second quarter as cost-cutting offset falling demand from cash-strapped consumers

item.title: German investor optimism at 3-year high
item.description: Germany’s economic rebound has gained momentum, with a closely watched survey showing investor confidence surging to its highest level in more than three years

item.title: Identity theft case puts 130m at risk
item.description: The US brought criminal charges over the alleged theft of account details linked to 130m credit cards, a case of identity theft that far exceeds anything of its kind that has ever come to light before

item.title: News Corp announces Star TV shake-up
item.description: News Corp unveiled details of a wide ranging shake-up of its Star Asian television arm as James Murdoch looks to cut costs and consolidate businesses in the region

item.title: Kim Dae-jung dies at 85
item.description: Kim Dae-jung, South Korea’s former leftist president who died at the age of 85, was a political brawler right to the finish

item.title: Dell joins stampede to launch smartphone
item.description: Dell is preparing to enter the smartphone business as mobile handset and computer makers converge on one of the few parts of the personal technology market to showing strong growth and profits

item.title: Investors’ fears are eased on Talf
item.description: The Federal Reserve and the US Treasury extended a $200bn programme designed to revive the securitisation market, bringing relief to investors concerned the supply of cheap government financing was set to end.

item.title: Japan opposition ahead as campaign starts
item.description: Japan’s Democratic party holds a wide lead over the long-ruling Liberal Democratic party in voter polls as official campaigning kicks off for an August 30 election

item.title: GM completes Saab deal with Koenigsegg
item.description: Accord will mark another step forward in efforts to restructure GM as the loss-making US carmaker narrows its range of brands

item.title: US claims to have thwarted Taliban
item.description: The US said that Taliban insurgents in Afghanistan had failed in a ferocious bid to derail the country’s Afghanistan’s elections, to be held on Thursday, with a wave of violent attacks.
